intro: Pleonotoma peregrina, commonly known as the wandering beetle, is a species of ground beetle belonging to the family Carabidae. It is characterized by its elongated, slender body and hard, metallic-colored exoskeleton. This beetle is typically found in moist, forested habitats where it preys on small invertebrates. Pleonotoma peregrina is known for its agile movement and ability to navigate through dense undergrowth. Its life cycle includes a larval stage that is often cryptic and difficult to observe in the wild.
